definition: car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
station/to stand/to halt/to stop/branch of a company or organization/website

sentences.english: Look, there is a bus stop.
sentences.chinese: 看，有个公共汽车停车站。

sentences.english: Our school is across from the bus stop.
sentences.chinese: 我们学校在公汽停车站对面。

sentences.english: The road to success has many tempting parking places.
sentences.chinese: 在通往成功的路上有许多诱惑的停车站。

sentences.english: A bus came just as I got to the stop.
sentences.chinese: 我刚到停车站，一辆公共汽车就来了。

sentences.english: The city also built 40 two-tiered, weather-protected, bike parking structures.
sentences.chinese: 此外，广州还修建了40座双层封闭式自行车停车站。

sentences.english: The conductor won't let anybody off between stops.
sentences.chinese: 在两个停车站之间，售票员是不会让任何人下车的。

sentences.english: A bus cam. just as I got to the stop.
sentences.chinese: 我刚到停车站，一辆公共汽车就来了。

definition: bus or tram stop/intermediate stop (on route of ship, plane etc)/port of call/stopover
terminus/final stop on rail or bus line
train or coach service ("service" as in "they run 12 services per day between the two cities")
departure (of a coach or train)/to dispatch a vehicle
bus information board/street sign for a bus stop/bus stop
(of trains etc) to set off (on a journey)/to start (being issued or circulated)/to start (happening)/originating
